result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi M Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by the RISK Assessment and jail administration.
*Huber for employment, childcare and any counseling she may be involved in.
*No credit unless parties stipulate

miscConds.notes:
*Not be on the premises of the Shopko Store in Plover, WI  
*Submit DNA Sample, if not already done so.
*Not to have any checking account without the agents approval.
*Work full-time.  Can go to school part-time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heidi M Sullivan in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:23 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  No victims are present.
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1: 
90 days jail STAYED
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Huber for employment, childcare and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
Pay restitution of $1,471.04
Not be on the premises of the Shopko Store in Plover, WI. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so. 
Not to have any checking account without the agents approval. 
10 hours community service. 
Work full-time.  Can go to school part-time. 

Parties discuss credit. 
BY THE COURT:  No credit unless parties stipulate. 

Count 2: 
90 days jail, concurrent STAYED
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Huber for employment, childcare and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Court advises post-conviction rights.
Plea hearing on April 5, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Was cancelled in Court by intake Judge (Not issued code used on 03-17-16).
cc:  DA w/ mintues sent 03/23/16 sp

Defendant Heidi M Sullivan in court with attorney Eric McFarland for Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen for Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:35 p.m.  case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a return on warrant.
ADA indicates he warrant was to be held 
Court questions the whereabouts of the defendant.  Defendant was incarcerated in Marathon County
1516 23rd Avenue S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495

Warrant is quashed.
ADA requests bond be reinstated.  
Atty. McFarland requests a new date as its Atty. Drengler's matter.
Bond previously set is continued.
1:41 p.m. case is concluded.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea Hearing set for 03/11/16 - moved, left no address
cash alternative of $1,500.00 - on hold until Monday, March 14, 2016 at 12:00 p.m. if there is no satisfactory explanation as to why the defendant did not appear

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:05 am. Court calls case.
Atty Drengler indicates that the defendant was in custody in Wood Co and he has not had contact with her. 
Atty Drengler intends to contact the probation officer to acquire updated address for the defendant.
Atty Molepske requests a bench warrant be issued.
Atty Drengler requests matter be continued.

BY THE COURT:
Court authrozies a Bench Warrant on the defendant's non appearance with a $1,500 cash alternative and will have it on hold until Monday, March 14, 2016 at 12:00 pm. If no satisfactory explanation is given as to why defendant did not appear, Court will issue the Warrant.
Plea hearing on March 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for 01/19/16 - return to sender/unable to forward
Pre-Trial Conference set for 02/29/16 - not deliverable as addressed
Pre-trial conference at 02-29-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Heidi M Sullivan in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond to continue.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance at 01-19-2016 01:30 pm

Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks. 
If defendant has any open checking accounts, she is not to attempt to write any checks from that account.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following places:  Shopko Store in Stevens Point

1:45 pm. Court calls case.
Atty Molepske indicates this matter is on a return on warrant.
State requests warrant be quashed.

BTC:
Warrant is quashed.

State requests $1500 signature bond with conditions stated.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
